content.1: Him that is weak in the faith receive ye,
content.2: For one believeth that he may eat all things: another, who is weak, eateth herbs.
content.3: Let not him that eateth despise him that eateth not; and let not him which eateth not judge him that eateth: for God hath received him.
content.4: Who art thou that judgest another man’s servant? to his own master he standeth or falleth. Yea, he shall be holden up: for God is able to make him stand.
content.5: One man esteemeth one day above another: another esteemeth every day
content.6: He that regardeth the day, regardeth
content.7: For none of us liveth to himself, and no man dieth to himself.
content.8: For whether we live, we live unto the Lord; and whether we die, we die unto the Lord: whether we live therefore, or die, we are the Lord’s.
content.9: For to this end Christ both died, and rose, and revived, that he might be Lord both of the dead and living.
content.10: But why dost thou judge thy brother? or why dost thou set at nought thy brother? for we shall all stand before the judgment seat of Christ.
content.12: So then every one of us shall give account of himself to God.
content.13: Let us not therefore judge one another any more: but judge this rather, that no man put a stumblingblock or an occasion to fall in
content.14: I know, and am persuaded by the Lord Jesus, that
content.15: But if thy brother be grieved with
content.16: Let not then your good be evil spoken of:
content.17: For the kingdom of God is not meat and drink; but righteousness, and peace, and joy in the Holy Ghost.
content.18: For he that in these things serveth Christ
content.19: Let us therefore follow after the things which make for peace, and things wherewith one may edify another.
content.20: For meat destroy not the work of God. All things indeed
content.23: And he that doubteth is damned if he eat, because
